meanings.sent1: The phagocytic cells in the body help fight off infections.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the phagocytic process is crucial for our immune system.
meanings.sent3: The phagocytic immune cells were like tiny superheroes gobbling up the bacteria.
meanings.sent4: Her phagocytic ability to clear out debris was compared to a diligent cleaner sweeping a room.
meanings.sent5: The phagocytic nature of the white blood cells was like a protective shield around the body.

meanings.sent1: The phagocytic cells were able to engulf and destroy harmful particles.
meanings.sent2: The immune system relies on phagocytic cells to keep the body healthy.
meanings.sent3: The phagocytic ability of the cells was like having tiny vacuum cleaners inside the body.
meanings.sent4: Her phagocytic power was compared to a voracious eater consuming everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The phagocytic function of the cells was as efficient as a well-oiled machine.
